stories.title: Stock Market Crash: Expert Warns of 80% Drop Following Melt-Up

stories.text:
Basically the title.

Have changed multiple jobs have worked in both startups and big corps, moving to a first world country, "making it big", salary is on "7 digits" as late 20s year old. I should be happy with my career. But I'm not.

I cant seem to care even for a minute for my job. I literally can't even understand why everyone even cares. Most of it is pointless, its just being busy for busyness's sake. I also don't care about new programming technologies/frameworks/languages as 99.9% of it is just iterations of existing stuff that someone created to promote themselves, boost their ego or just had some free time.

How,and why do you care about your job? What did you change in your work environment or your own thinking that made you like your work more?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do I care about my IT job?

stories.text:
I am looking to build/get a tablet running Linux for tinkering purpose. I would like to save my money on this project (no need for performance yet). A few approaches came up in my research: - Buy a PineTab/RasPad/CutiePi. - Buy a Chromebook tablet and install Linux on it. - Buy an Android tablet and try to install another Linux distro on it. Ubuntu Touch/postmarketOS are some options that came up on my research. - Buy a x86 (Intel Atom) device.

Is there any other approach that I am not aware of? Which would you guys recommend for a newbie?
stories.title: Ask HN: Any beginner-friendly, low-cost approach to building a Linux tablet?
